intro: [WRONG START] Hieracesium caesium subsp. coronaemontis, commonly known as the alpine hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads and robust, often hairy stems. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine habitats, preferring well-drained soils and full sun exposure. Its leaves are lance-shaped, with rough textures, and the flowers are yellow, arranged in a single head with ray florets. This subspecies is notable for its adaptation to high-altitude environments and its role in local ecosystems.
